parsed.internal_thinking: My current settlement at Node 20 provides Wood (11), Brick (6), and Sheep (8). This gives me a solid foundation for basic building. Player A's settlement at Node 41 gives them Ore (5), Wheat (9), and Brick (10), indicating a strong start in those resources. My strategy from the previous turn was to focus on acquiring Wheat and Ore to balance my economy and secure an Ore port. I have evaluated Node 26 as the prime location for my second settlement. Node 26 is connected to Hexes 12 (Ore 3) and 7 (Wheat 8). Crucially, Node 26 also provides access to an Ore 2:1 port. This selection perfectly aligns with my strategic goal of obtaining Wheat and Ore, which are essential for building cities and development cards, and securing a specific port for efficient trading of my most valuable resource. With settlements at Node 20 and Node 26, my resource production will include Wood (11), Brick (6), Sheep (8), Wheat (8), and Ore (3), along with an Ore port, providing a well-rounded and powerful starting position for the game. Node 26 is currently available and not blocked by any existing settlements or roads from other players. The robber is on Hex 10 (Desert), which does not affect Node 26.
parsed.note_to_self: Successfully placed second settlement at Node 26, securing strong Wheat (8), Ore (3) production, and an Ore 2:1 port. My resource base is now balanced: W11, B6, S8, Wh8, O3. Next turn, I will need to focus on expanding roads towards potential city spots, or considering development card purchases depending on initial rolls and player actions. Keep an eye on Player A's expansion, especially towards Ore and Wheat hexes.
parsed.say_outloud: Settling down with a strong base of Wheat and Ore! Looking forward to some good rolls and expanding my network.
